title: How to Make Bubble Blowing Tools

steps.headline: Make a large bubble wand.
steps.description: Using string and two straws, you can make an amazing bubble wand; read the instructions here: How to make a large bubble wand.

steps.headline: Use pipe cleaners.
steps.description: Bend the pipe cleaner into a neat circle or shape (moon, heart, star, etc.) at one end and hold it from the other.

steps.headline: Use your own fingers.
steps.description: You can create a simple loop on one hand using your thumb and index finger. It's both easy to make and portable!

steps.headline: Use a turkey baster.
steps.description: Simply soak up the bubble mix and squeeze for bubbles!

steps.headline: Look for items with lots of holes and potential.
steps.description: For example, plastic berry baskets can make great many-bubbles-at-once blowing tools. They're light to hold and easy to dip into the bubble mixture.

text: Make a large bubble wand. Using string and two straws, you can make an amazing bubble wand; read the instructions here: How to make a large bubble wand. Use pipe cleaners. Bend the pipe cleaner into a neat circle or shape (moon, heart, star, etc.) at one end and hold it from the other. Use your own fingers. You can create a simple loop on one hand using your thumb and index finger. It's both easy to make and portable! Use a turkey baster. Simply soak up the bubble mix and squeeze for bubbles! Look for items with lots of holes and potential. For example, plastic berry baskets can make great many-bubbles-at-once blowing tools. They're light to hold and easy to dip into the bubble mixture.
